basics.name: Ido Asraff
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Autodidact 8200 Alumnus, experienced in software engineering and research. Passionate about system architecture and code design. Committed to continuous learning and technological breakthroughs.

education.institution: Bnei Akiva Lapid Modiin Yeshiva High School

work.name: Unit 8200
highlights: Developed a Procedural-Call framework from scratch, over a new and efficient protocol.
Built a new team to deliver a unique development tool extensively used within the community.
Delved deep into Software Architecture, writing educational guides and serving as an expert.
Technologies: Linux, Android, Binder, Java, Kotlin, C, C++, Python

work.name: 8200 “Apollo” Course
highlights: Created itineraries, organized study sessions, and external lectures.
Ensured personal pupils succeeded and improved in their skills.

work.name: 8200 “Gome” Course
highlights: Created itineraries, organized study sessions, and external lectures.
Led and instructed a small group of students.
Developed extensively on a large-scale, highly portable program spanning networking, module management, and custom protocols.
Developed a unique Dependency-Injection framework for Java projects.
Implemented high-end solutions for complex Inter-Process-Communication problems using Java annotation-processing.

work.name: 8200 “Apollo” Course
highlights: 4.5 months of intense study including Python, C++, Networking, and OS.

work.name: Skillz (Under Western Digital)
highlights: Won second place in the Skillz 2018 Cyber High-schools Championship.
Worked for about 8 months on the next Skillz Competition.
Gained experience in game design, graphics, backend, and frontend development.
